PostExample/0-0-0-7/examples/using-nulls.html:
Nullstack can be used as to build a Chrome Extension.<\/p>

These are all the changes required to make the app compatible as an extension:<\/p>

  • public/manifest.json<\/code> creates the Chrome Extension manifest file<\/li>
  • server.js<\/code> disables the default service worker, as the extension doesn't need it<\/li>
  • src/Application.jsx<\/code> is the entry component that will render the Popup code<\/li>
  • package.json<\/code> sets mode to SPA (default mode) and enables writing files to disk<\/li> <\/ul>

    You can find a full example at Mortaro/nullstack-chrome-extension<\/a>.<\/p>
